greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A049501(phi(n)).
comment: a(n) = Major index (1st definition) of the total numbers <=n and prime to n i.e., phi(n).
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Indranil Ghosh, Python Program to generate the sequence
example: For n = 10, phi(n) = 4 and major index (1st definition) of 4 = 1. So a(n) = 1.
results.author: _Indranil Ghosh_, Jan 07 2017
